elements.name: Cert Message
elements.html:
By filing a weekly claim, you are requesting an Unemployment Insurance (UI) benefit payment. It is important that you answer all questions accurately and truthfully. You are legally responsible for the information reported on your weekly claim. The information you enter on this application will be saved until 6:00 p.m. on Friday <>, if you do not submit this application today.

You will be logged out of the application if there is no activity for ## minutes.

You must file your weekly claim application Sunday through Friday to request benefits for the previous week. If you do not file your weekly claim within the allowed 6 days, you are denied benefits for that week. You must file a new claim application to reactivate your claim and begin filing weekly claims again.

Preparing to file your weekly claim:
  • You will be asked about the pay you?ve received and earned the previous week (ex: wages, holiday, vacation, pension, severance pay, and workers? compensation)
  • You will be asked for the following information regarding your work searches, if applicable
    • Date you applied for the job
    • Company name
    • Company address, website or email address
    • The job for which you applied
WARNING:
If you withhold or provide false information to increase or collect UI benefits, you are committing fraud. Fraudulently collecting UI benefits is a serious offense and will be investigated. If you have an overpayment as a result of fraudulent claim activity, you will not receive UI benefits until you have paid your debt in full.

elements.name: Were you Actively SW text
elements.html: It is your responsibility to keep a complete record of your work search contacts and to provide a copy when requested.

elements.name: Were you Actively SW
elements.title: Were you actively looking for work during the week of <<benefitWeekStartDate>> through <<benefitWeekEndDate>>?

elements.name: Contact Reporting
elements.html:
You must report a minimum of two (2) work search contacts each week.
  • Employer contacts must be made between Sunday and Saturday of the week for which you are filing a claim
  • Your work search must be a reasonable and honest effort to find suitable work
  • You must be willing to accept a reasonable wage in your area for the job for which you applied
  • A repeat or follow-up work search for the same position with one employer can be made after six weeks from the initial contact
You may be denied benefits if you fail to:
  • Make a minimum of two work searches during each week you are claimant benefits
  • Submit a record of the work searches upon request

elements.name: UHH 0 text
elements.html: It is your responsibility to keep a complete record of your work search contacts and provide a copy when requested. You are required to search for work by contacting your union hiring hall each week.

elements.name: UHH 0
elements.title: Did you contact the union hiring hall to check for available work during the week of <<benefitWeekStartDate>> through <<benefitWeekEndDate>>

elements.name: UHH 0A
elements.html: You are required to contact your union hiring hall weekly to check for available work. You reported you did not make the contact for this week. Your benefits may be denied as a result of this information. If you searched for work through other methods, please provide this information.

elements.name: UHH 0A1
elements.title: Were your union hiring hall dues current for the week?

elements.name: How many contacts?
elements.title: How many work search contacts did you make during the week of <<benefitWeekStartDate>> through <<benefitWeekEndDate>>?

elements.name: Not enough
elements.html: You are required to make a minimum of two (2) work search efforts each week. You reported fewer than two (2) work searches for this week. Your benefits may be denied as a result of this information.

elements.name: Not enough 1
elements.html: You are required to make a minimum of one (1) work search effort during the week. You did not report a work search contact for this week. Your benefits may be denied as a result of this information.

elements.name: info10
elements.html:
You must report gross income you have earned during the week of <> through <>, even if you haven?t yet received the pay

If you are working part-time or temporarily, you are required by law to report your earnings, regardless of the amount.

elements.name: Gross Income Reporting
elements.title: Did you recieve:

elements.name: Work Earnings 1
elements.html:
Because you worked during the week of <> through <>, you must report your gross earnings (before taxes are taken out).

Enter the following information about the employer(s) you worked for during the week.

* indicates a required field.

elements.name: info12
elements.html:
Please provide a copy of your award letter in one of the following ways:
1. Upload the appropriate documents through your Claimant Portal
2. Bring your documentation to an IowaWORKS Center
3. Mail the appropriate documents with a letter requesting to be verified, to the following address:

Iowa Workforce Development
Unemployment Insurance Benefits
1000 East Grand Avenue
Des Moines, Iowa 50319-0209

elements.name: info15
elements.html:
I certify the following:
  • I am totally or partially unemployed.
  • I have accurately reported all pay I have received or will receive for the week of <> through <>.
  • I have reported all issues that could limit my availability and/or ability to work or to attend approved school/training classes
  • I have reported all issues that could limit my availability and/or ability to work or to attend approved school/training classes
  • I understand that if I make false statements, provide false information, or knowingly withhold information for the purpose of receiving benefits I may be fined, penalized, or criminally prosecuted.
  • I understand that I must repay any UI benefits that I was not eligible to receive.

elements.name: certification
elements.title: Do you agree?
